content.body: nicolo-ribaudo: do you know why step 7.1 of https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#hostloadimportedmodule never does anything with _requested_?
content.formatted_body: nicolo-ribaudo: do you know why step 7.1 of https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#hostloadimportedmodule never does anything with requested?

content.body: Anyone interested in being the second reviewer of a percent-encoding refactoring? https://github.com/whatwg/url/pull/896

Inside the loop it should use requested instead of moduleRequest.

The goal there is "when loading the first moduleRequest of a module, validate all of them first".
content.formatted_body:
Inside the loop it should use requested instead of moduleRequest.

The goal there is "when loading the first moduleRequest of a module, validate all of them first".

content.body:
Bit of a random one, but WebIDL currently forbids a trailing comma in extended attribute lists, but WebKit uses this pattern quite extensively. Should we just update the spec to allow that grammar?

Servo also seems to support the trailing comma (not sure if it's used), chromium seems to forbid it and I'm not sure about Firefox but I think it forbids it too.
The WebIDL parsers in Firefox and Servo have a common source, but might have diverged at some point, I suppose

Linkedin says Alex Mogilevsky is back at Google now. Would be wonderful if he’s on the Chrome team, but it looks more likely that he might be working on AI stuff. And unsurprising, if so.

*“Renowned engineer joins AI team at company X”* is more of  “Dog bites man” story these days.
*“Renowned engineer joins browser-engine project”* would be more of the “[Man bites dog](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man_bites_dog)” story.
